Samantha had always been fascinated by the group of skateboarders who would gather at the end of her street every Saturday afternoon. She would watch from her bedroom window as they perfected their moves, flipping and spinning their boards with effortless grace.

One day, after mustering up her courage, Samantha headed down to the group of spectators to watch the skateboarding up close. As she looked around, she noticed that everyone's shoes were captured in the footage, but no one had ever seen the skateboarders' faces.

Determined to get to know them better, Samantha decided to start her own skateboard collection and practice her skills. She spent every spare moment working on her moves and tricks, and before long, she was one of the regulars at the weekly gatherings.

It wasn't until Samantha had been skating with the group for a few months that she discovered the secret behind their anonymity. All of the skateboarders wore masks to keep their identities hidden, and they never spoke a word to anyone outside of their inner circle. But Samantha didn't mind; she was having too much fun skating and socializing with the group.

One sunny Saturday afternoon, Samantha was practicing her newest move when she lost control of her skateboard and sent it hurtling into the crowd of spectators. As she followed the board into the crowd, she was shocked to see her father's face staring back at her from behind one of the masks.

It turned out that Samantha's father had been one of the skateboarders all along, unbeknownst to her. After revealing his identity, he invited Samantha to join the group on their next skateboarding road trip, and the two spent the rest of the day bonding over their shared love of the sport.

On the river, the boat does float,
Chasing waves, like a billy goat.
People in helmets, life jackets too,
Drifting and oaring, the water so blue.

And jump off, into the water deep.
Some spin and twirl in the air,
Others pinch their noses, with a dare.

In the boat, they squirt and play,
With water guns, on this sunny day.
They jump off, with flips and dives,
Splashing around, like happy jives.

With food and friends, a yacht appears,
The view of the sea, so crystal-clear.
The raft is pulled, behind the boat,
Continuing the fun, with a happy note.

On the river, the fun never ends,
With splashes, and laughs, and new friends.
The sun sets on this perfect day,
Leaving behind, memories that will stay.

questions_and_answers.question: Can you explain how the gameplay works in shuffleboard?
questions_and_answers.answer: In shuffleboard, the objective is to push your own ball to the opposite side while trying to push the opponent's ball outside the line. The game is usually played on a long rectangular board with scoring zones at each end.
